review_title: Help Others To Know Their True Protentials
job_title: Materials Engineer Intern in Belleville, MI
pros:
To improve the development of community workforce.
Help create future leaders understand that humble beginnings is where the heart stays.
Staying connected to people in a non-profit organization help me to understand that serving others in need is key to true prosperity.
cons: Not able to help everyone and working with others who can care less about.
Information is not shared and pay is low

pros: Colleagues are great and very passionate
cons: Cautious leadership, low compensation for expectations

pros: Flexible timegreat abot of PTO and good enviroment
It depends on the department you work in. It can be hit or miss.
cons: Sometimes you are stereotyped. showing youe skill asset can be limited.

pros: There are no pros at all
cons: Work us like slaves, doesn't receive all breaks, have a lot of shutdowns, like 3 months at a time with no pay. We do not receive all the holiday pay days that is in the handbook.  They decide at the last minute if we are going to get holiday pay or not.  We never know what time we get off of work, works 14-16 hours a day. The employees that work in the office receives a Christmas bonus but the employees that work in the plant doesn't. You will get penalized or fired if you are sick or in the hospital. You can not use a doctors excuse, you will be penalized& get fired!!! They will not accept a doctors excuse, and they can see that you are sick, you will still get penalized or fired, because of  point system. and we only get 7 points.

review_title: Focus: HOPE is not what it was
pros: The legacy of the organization is strong

review_title: Good Working Place with a lots of opportunities for personal and professional growth.
pros: Easy going colleagues, warm work environment, personal development opportunities, flexible work environment, good employee benefits and many employee welfare activities
cons: New University, processes not established, need to be more careful during the initial years in getting the right teams with commitment, competence and charisma.
